content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

module Main
    function wrap_string(text::String) where TextWidth == Int, output :: String
        words = text.split(" ")
        result = ""
        current_width = 0
        for word in words do
            if current_width + length(word) > TextWidth then
                result << "\n"
                current_width = 0
            end if
            result << word
            current_width += length(word) + 1 # add space after each word
        end for
        return result
    end function
endmodule

text = "This is an example text that will be wrapped to multiple lines using the `wrap_string` function. It should handle different numbers of words and their lengths."
result = Main.wrap_string(text)
println(result)
